skill.name: devflow-file-standards
skill.description: File naming conventions, directory structure, and YAML frontmatter standards for CC-DevFlow. Consolidates shared conventions from all agents.
skill.summary: File naming conventions, directory structure, and YAML frontmatter standards for CC-DevFlow. Consoli...
skill.author: Dimon94

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation about file naming conventions and directory structures. No executable code, network access, or file system operations detected. Pure documentation skill with zero security risk.

content.value_statement: Inconsistent file naming creates confusion and slows development. This skill enforces clear standards for naming conventions, directory structures, and metadata formats across your entire development workflow.
actual_capabilities: Enforces REQ-\d{3} format for requirement IDs
Standardizes T\d{3} format for task IDs
Mandates YAML frontmatter for PRD, TECH_DESIGN, EPIC, and TASKS files
limitations: Only handles naming conventions, not content standards
Fixed format patterns cannot be customized
Applies only to markdown and JSON files

use_cases.title: Standardize Project Structure
use_cases.description: Ensure all team members follow consistent file naming across requirements, tasks, and documentation.

use_cases.title: Automate File Organization
use_cases.description: Integrate standardized naming into AI-driven development workflows for automatic file generation.

use_cases.title: Structure Contributor Guidelines
use_cases.description: Provide clear file organization standards for contributors working on structured development projects.

prompt_templates.title: Check File Naming
prompt_templates.scenario: Verify a single file follows standards
prompt_templates.prompt: Is 'user-authentication.md' correctly named according to CC-DevFlow standards for a supporting document?

prompt_templates.title: Generate REQ-ID
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a valid REQ-ID for a user authentication feature following the REQ-\d{3} pattern.

prompt_templates.title: Structure Directory
prompt_templates.prompt: Create the complete directory structure for REQ-123 including all required subdirectories and files.

prompt_templates.title: Validate YAML Frontmatter
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify this YAML frontmatter contains all required fields for a PRD.md file: reqId, title, version, createdAt, updatedAt, status, author.

output_examples.input: What should I name my product requirements document?
output: Required YAML fields: reqId, title, version, createdAt, updatedAt, status, author

best_practices: Always validate REQ-ID format before creating directories
Use consistent naming patterns across all team projects
Include YAML frontmatter in all primary documents
anti_patterns: Mixing kebab-case and snake_case in same project
Creating custom file naming conventions outside standards
Skipping YAML frontmatter for primary documents

faq.question: Is this compatible with non-CC-DevFlow projects?
faq.answer: Yes, the naming conventions can be adopted independently, but full benefits require CC-DevFlow integration.

faq.question: Can I modify the naming patterns?
faq.answer: The patterns are fixed to ensure consistency across CC-DevFlow workflows. Custom patterns would break automation.

faq.question: Does this work with Git workflows?
faq.answer: Yes, standards include Git branch naming like 'feature/REQ-XXX-{slug-title}' for seamless integration.

faq.question: Is my project data safe?
faq.answer: This skill only provides naming standards. It doesn't access, store, or transmit any project data.

faq.question: What if files don't follow standards?
faq.answer: Use the validation scripts in .claude/scripts/ to check compliance before committing changes.

faq.question: How is this different from other file organization tools?
faq.answer: This is specifically designed for AI-driven development workflows with standardized metadata and status tracking.
